intro: Bulbophyllum orbiculare, commonly known as the orbicular orchid, is a species of orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its compact, bulbous pseudobulbs and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking, fragrant flowers in shades of white, yellow, and green, often with intricate patterns. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is popular among orchid enthusiasts and is often cultivated in greenhouses.
